dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: All right. We're doing the coverage. Camera here. Eli continues toward Cameron. Chuck is spraying ethyl chl his bare tattooed shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: ELI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Chuck) Careful. Don't blind the eagle. (to Cameron) I owe you six hundred bucks.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: (acknowledging the compliment ) If anything bothered you, be happy to do it again. Eli laughs and moves off, Cameron staring after him.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: (to Chuck) I can't take my eyes off the son-of- a-bitch. Everybody does what he wants them to, even me. I feel like thankin' him 'cause I fell on my ass.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: (sarcasm) ...It's just a crush. You'll get over it.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Approaching Eli, who turns to Sam, eager, vulnerable.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: What did you think?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: You are a smug, insufferable son-of- a-bitch. When I read the insane asylum scene to my wife and four children, my wife cried, my oldest son shook my hand for the first time in his whole life. So, why is it, Eli, that this vulgar little scene turns out to be so much...stronger, more moving?

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: (touched) God knows, Sam. Maybe...because you get the feeling that the enemy might just be some poor horny slob like you, lookin' for the nearest whorehouse. (putting his arm around Cameron) How about that, Lucky? When that stunt man's boob hit you in the mouth, was it just another boob...or did it taste like kraut? The crew laughs and so does Nina. Cameron feels humiliate patronizing tone.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: It tasted lousy. But what do I know? You try it, Eli. You're the expert in bad taste.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: (for the group) Uh-oh, sounds like the soldier's got his feelings hurt.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: Naw, naw. I just don't know about Germans. Where I was we only raped gooks.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: As though continuing previous dialogue.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: (genially) Oh, is that why the cops are after you? ...After all this time?

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) Damn! You finally guessed it!

dialogues.speaker: 100A
dialogues.text: Revealing Eli and Cameron walking through the hotel GARAG replica of the lost Duesenberg which a MECHANIC works on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...-Really? Rape? No. I think you're putting me on. Come on, now, no more hints. (he thinks) Let's see...Christ, could be anything. I know a guy in this state got 20 years for having cunnilingus with his wife. (studies Cameron) No...I guess you're not the type. More likely some hideous crime of violence... Eli is getting under Cameron's skin. They stop at car.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: (to mechanic) Have you seen Harvey?

dialogues.speaker: MECHANIC
dialogues.text: I think he's in there. Mechanic nods toward a door at the rear of the garage. El fender of the Duesenberg. Cameron views it with a strange unease. Putting his arm around Cameron's shoulder, Eli le toward the back door yelling to mechanic.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: You'll have it ready on time?

dialogues.speaker: MECHANIC
dialogues.text: Yeah, but don't look under the hood or you'll find a Chevy. At the door, Eli can barely open it to squeeze through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An incredible number of people have wedged themselves int smoke-filled room, peering over each other's heads toward area at the far end.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: (shouting) Harvey in here?

dialogues.speaker: OFFSTAGE VOICE
dialogues.text: (yelling) Quiet. We're shooting. (then back to business) Come on...let me have a little more face...a little more face! Eli squats on his haunches peering between the legs of th and tugs on Cameron's sleeve to join him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hazily, through the restless shifting limbs, male and fem the first rays of morning sun breaking through to the dep forest, we glimpse Raymond and Gabe shooting their eight epic: Two people screwing in a rowboat. Raymond suddenly his hands up in despair.

dialogues.speaker: RAYMOND
dialogues.text: (screaming) Cut! (indignantly) Jesus, Kenneth. Great control. All right, who's doubling for Kenny on the inserts?

dialogues.speaker: ELI AND CAMERON
dialogues.text: Cameron and Eli rise to their feet.

dialogues.speaker: ELI

dialogues.speaker: NINA'S PARENTS

dialogues.text: She's now made up to look like a woman in her forties. Ev about her tells us these have been brutal years, filled w and loss. She is reacting in anguish to something 0.S. Bu though she manages a few tears, it doesn't quite ring tru steps into the shot.

dialogues.text: Nina. The shame of it...the shame! You've lost your son, your lover. You want to tear his throat out... but you stand meek...your guts burning with the shame of it.

dialogues.speaker: NINA
dialogues.text: God, I don't know what's wrong with me. She has looked up at her parents, who stand off to one si zombies, watching.

dialogues.text: (upset ) Honey...you better know this...don't get all shook up now... Nina looks at him with foreboding.

dialogues.speaker: NINA
dialogues.text: She has not blinked, not turned her heard, for fear that father's eyes might meet hers. She is like a statue tremb earthquake, about to shatter. The sick, loathesome shame her, brims over and the statue’s blind eyes flow tears.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: Tense, barely breathing.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: (an urgent whisper) ...Roll film. He eases back out of view. The ANGLE SLOWLY TIGHTENS.  163 164

dialogues.speaker: NINA
dialogues.text: As she falls apart before our eyes, and an 0.S. VOICE on TAPE insinuates into our consciousness, echoing as though through many loudspeakers.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: I envy you the pride you must feel today. A young hero has fallen gloriously on the field of battle. Hands reach in and drape a sash around Nina's throat. Fro dangles a SWASTIKA. For Nina, there is still no voice, no only the obliterating shame for that image of her naked b into her father's memory. And yet, that shame is so simil shame she should be feeling as the woman in Eli's film at mockery of her son's death.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: A nation has lost a son! A mother has lost a son! The sound has now grown to a proportion reminiscent of th newsreels of Hitler victory rallies.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The THUNDEROUS SOUND of ten thousand voices shouting: "Si Sieg Heil!" has shattered Nina's isolation. She is now aw her personal despair has been used to accomplish an actin and it only adds to her degradation and sense of shame, i making her performance even more poignant. The crowd on t playback roars with fanatic zeal.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: Striding rapidly down the hall, looking like a man who ho a fight, to dissipate his residual anger. He rounds a cor almost colliding with Eli, who comes rapidly from an inte corridor. Eli puts his arm around Cameron's shoulder, hur along even faster.

dialogues.text: Giddyap, soldier. Last one there's on Medicare. Cameron shrugs his arm off in annoyance as they round the hurrv down some STAIRS.

dialogues.text: Where are we rushing to? I Was asleep...

dialogues.speaker: ELI

dialogues.speaker: ELI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Stick of gum? Makes you hum! (ignored, he chews it himself ) Do you read?

dialogues.text: (looking at the book as he walks) What the hell is this?

dialogues.speaker: ELI

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: (hands it back to him)  165

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: There you go rejecting me again. Eli pushes open the double doors and they find themselves in the MAKESHIFT SCREENING ROOM.

dialogues.speaker: ELI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You've gotta think positive, Burt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake is there with SEVERAL OTHER MEN. But before Cameron register who they are, Eli is saying...

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, gentlemen, but I've got exactly two minutes of borrowed time. I'm in the middle of a scene. (to projectionist) Get it started. Immediately the lights snap off and the film is projected screen. In the dark, the men in the room fumble their way On the projection screen we see a helicopter SHOT OF THE APPROACHING THE BRIDGE. Cameron is suddenly alert like a beast who's just heard the trap slam shut behind him. His around at the official-looking faces staring at the 0.S. face looks disturbingly familiar, but in the dark he can'

dialogues.text: (addressing a man next to him) This fellow here is the stunt man driving that car. (to Cameron) Thompson is from the FBI. They wanted you here in case they have any questions. On the projection screen, we see the DUESENBERG GO OFF TH THE BRIDGE, disappear in the water.

dialogues.text: Cameron moves swiftly down the corridor behind Eli, who s the stairs, still blithely chewing his gum.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: I'm trying to figure it out. That film. Where was I?

dialogues.speaker: ELI

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: Three-foot-six.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: Good boy. I got all kinds of versions. Wanna go back and see some? Cameron understands the implied threat and Eli, knowing h his point, continues good-humoredly.

dialogues.text: (chewing gum) Hey, kid, what is this with you? That red dye must be eating through your scalp and affecting your brain. Why would I want to hurt you?

dialogues.text: I think it's beautiful. It's heroic! I think it's a major work that may rank with the Edsel grill! Now goddamnit, I gotta go back and do my picture! Will you take this thing and read?! He holds the booklet out to him and it is very hard for C reach out and take it. Out of the corner of his eye, he s FBI MEN leaving the building, heading off in another dire stares at the booklet.

dialogues.text: (softly) I knew a guy...who stepped on a bouncing Betty booby trap. Stepping on it wasn't his problem...they explode when vou step off. So all  167

dialogues.text: he could do was just stand there. It was getting light. If we didn't get out, we'd of been shot up. So we left... Eli has been watching him thoughtfully.

dialogues.text: ...He had this screwy West Texas accent, I remember, "Hey fellas...hey fellas..." Eli blows a BUBBLE with his gum that POPS on cue as thoug the explosion of the bouncing Betty. Grinning, he sticks booklet in Cameron's shirt pocket, turns and walks off.

dialogues.text: Chuck keeps an eye on him.

dialogues.speaker: ELI

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Bullshit.  168

dialogues.text: He's like one of those land mines left over from a war, that go off from time to time. You read about it in the paper two or three years later...some kid in a bell tower shoots a dozen students for no reason at all...his mother says he was always such a good boy...I guess I'd like to know what he really did. As they reach the set, Gabe, the cameraman, charges up.

dialogues.text: Scattered about the room are suitcases, a wardrobe trunk, completed packing for tomorrow's departure. Nina lies in staring into nothing, Cameron beside her. Each is talking himself, adrift in his private world, unaware they have l with the other. The room is semi-dark, except for the nig light on Cameron's side, by which he studies the BOOKLET him.

dialogues.speaker: NINA
dialogues.text: ...It was so unnecessary...For Christ's sake, I'm no shrinking violet...I've had my ass pinched black and blue by account execs for not showing enough enthusiasm for Vitalis. But this from Eli...it was so pointless...sadistic...

dialogues.text: (reading) ..."Open All windows slowly to keep pressure from caving in the roof, should an unexpected skid achieve aquatic consequences..." That's kind of witty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still in her own world) ...Could've handled it later on. It doesn't look so raunchy after it's cut...Maybe I'd of got them stoned...something...but for Eli to trap them like that...

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: (eyes on the book) Beautiful...There's a second school of thought that says the first school is all wet. It says, "Keep the windows rolled up tight and wait for the air bubble."

dialogues.speaker: NINA
dialogues.text: Say it was an accident...benefit of the doubt. But then to use me that way...like a gadget...why would Eli do that? He's not a cruel man...

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: (not looking up) He's not a cruel man. He's a crazy man. A maniac.

dialogues.speaker: NINA
dialogues.text: what?

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: (reading) "The water pressure at two hundred feet can crush a man into the size of an egg." He wants to get that on film....so he's gonna kill me.

dialogues.speaker: NINA
dialogues.text: (jumping out of bed) What in God's name are you babbling about?!

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: It's a rotten shame about your folks and your naked ass, but dying always scared me a little, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and you are beginning to scare me. You're talking like a wild man!...

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: Did you know that Eli almost strangled a man because he stopped the camera when Burt got killed?!

dialogues.speaker: NINA
dialogues.text: What is going on in that head of yours?! You take the word of some...malcontent...technician!

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: ...I saw the bruises!

dialogues.speaker: NINA
dialogues.text: ...And I saw Eli that night when he had to tell Burt's brother on the phone...I saw the tears.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: She saw the tears! Did you ask him what he was crying about?! 'Cause you can bet your sweet tits, it wasn't over Burt. He was crying over losing his fucking shot! To keep from exploding, Nina opens her luggage and furiou repacking.

dialogues.speaker: NINA
dialogues.text: Didn't they give I.Q. tests in the army? What did you get...minus twelve? Haven't you figured out yet why he's working himself to death? What his film is all about? He's trying to tell people not to kill each other!

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: And you know what? You want the shock of your life...? I understand what the son-of-a-bitch is saying, and he may be right...which makes me what? Minus twelve, the dumb schmuck with a gun. That doesn't change the fact that he's crazy. If he had his way, there wouldn't be a soldier left alive bv mornina. But

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: all he's got on hand is me. I don't know if he is doing it consciously, but it's a hell of an idea. If he can really get it on film, a genuine dumb fuck grunt cashing in, before your very eyes, I mean the real McCoy...that's gotta help his picture...Then he's killed two birds with one stone. It's got a nice logic. Trouble is, both birds are me. Against her instincts, Nina is emotionally affected by wh says.

dialogues.speaker: NINA
dialogues.text: Stop it...sweetheart...I'd die if anything happened to you. The TELEPHONE RINGS. Her head whips to look at it. It con ringing, but she doesn't move.

dialogues.speaker: NINA
dialogues.text: It's my father...I won't talk to him...You're all driving me crazy...I won't talk to him.! Cameron calmly picks up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: Hi...hello?

dialogues.speaker: NINA
dialogues.text: (whispering) Tell them I'm not here. Tell them anything. Tell them I'm working.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: (glancing at Nina) Okay, Chuck. I'll meet you in an hour. (he hangs up) For me. Amazing how they keep secrets around here. He walks over to the still-stricken Nina and tenderly emb She leans against him, the trembling subsiding.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: What if I told you I wasn't going to do the stunt?

dialogues.speaker: NINA
dialogues.text: I'd say fine.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: And what if I told you I was gonna get out of here tonight...and that I want you to come with me?

dialogues.speaker: NINA
dialogues.text: (upset and confused) But there's just one more day of shooting...

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: What if I can't wait?

dialogues.speaker: NINA
dialogues.text: I...I have two more scenes...

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: That's a shame.

dialogues.speaker: NINA
dialogues.text: ...I could meet you... When he doesn't answer, Nina resorts to her last defense, anger.

dialogues.speaker: NINA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ...Look, don't do the stunt! If you believe Eli's a killer, call the police...Why are you doing this to me? That's all I need right now, with all I've been through!...For you to give me now-or-never ultimatums and tell me my director is insane!... By now she is stalking about the room throwing things fro suitcase to another as Cameron silently watches her.  169

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which stands alone like Moby Dick awaiting its victim. Ch Cameron appear from behind the car, stalking it like it w Sunday Special on a used car lot, Chuck the "hearty" sale Cameron the reluctant customer.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: Look at this mother...I'll bet these guys could build an Arabian out of a jackass.

dialogues.text: Why not? You built a stunt man out of one.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: Stunt man? Three days and you've already grown those big brass balls? Jump up and down and let me hear ‘em clang, and then do me a favor and leave 'em home for this gag. (yanks open the door) There's just enough room in that Duesenberg for a normal guy...who thinks! (Cameron slides in) Show me how long you can hold your breath. Cameron inhales deeply and Chuck clicks his stopwatch.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: Now, look around. Whaddya see?...No roll bar in the roof. That's because the roof caving in really looks gassy on film. You got your protection in the back of the seat...steel sheeting. If the roof goes too far, you get your goddamn head down quick! You listening to me?!...Nod Your head. (slapping Cameron on back) You got good lungs. (buckles Cameron's seatbelt) You got no shoulder harness because it would show on camera. So when you hit the water, you brace yourself against the steering wheel. It's reinforced. You couldn't break it loose with dynamite...you gettin' light-headed yet? Cameron shakes his head, "No."

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: Keep your hands off the doors... You're leaving through the window. You lower them slowly as you sink to equalize the pressure. What are you waitin' for? I'm not gonna be down there holding your hand. (Cameron lowering windows ) Slower. When you hit bottom, the windows are open and you're gonna make like a minnow. But first, a little fresh air wouldn't hurt. You reach down under the seat and, what do you know, a respirator...Make like you're reaching for it. There'll be one there tomorrow. Cameron reaches for the non-existent respirator.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No, keep your face forward, the camera is behind you and it's still running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By this time, Cameron's breath is giving out and he's str hold it.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You feel like your lungs are gonna burst? Good. That's the way you're supposed to act like you feel. The Moment that water gets above your nose, you gotta look like you're drowning. Remember? Burt wasn't so good at that. That knocks the wind out of Cameron.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: He sure as hell convinced me. Chuck clicks his stopwatch and scowls.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: (defensively) Things happen crossin' the street! If somethin' goes cockeyed...screw the scene! Get that mask on. There's enough oxygen to get you to China. (rolls up the window) We'll try it again.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: (still panting) Let me catch my breath.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: What you'll catch is a lungful of water! You're at the bottom of the river!...You breathe when I goddamn tell you to breathe!

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: (the pupil tricking the teacher ) Hey, Chuck, you blind?...Can't you see I've got my respirator on?

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: You just goddamn remember you don't have gills!! 169A Chuck has stalked over to the WORKBENCH and angrily PHONE. which has been rinaina incessantlv over the last f  170

dialogues.text: (shouting) what?! ! (listens, then yells to Cameron) Eli's at the police station!

dialogues.text: He needs Gabe. They're lookin' for a driver so I'm gonna take him. Come on with me.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: (climbing into the company car) You and me are gonna talk about windows and oxygen and seat belts and things like that. And if you're a good boy and listen and don't be a smart ass, maybe I'll let you sit in the back seat with Nina Franklin.

dialogues.text: (beckoning) Gabe, Nina... Eli pulls Gabe and Nina toward the police station, yellin Cameron and Chuck.

dialogues.text: I hate this, damn it! Couldn't you have done it without me?

dialogues.text: Let's say you owe it to him. Until two or three days ago, I had a pretty good actor on my hands. Next time you take out the clippers, be a little humane, make sure the guy's got one to spare.

dialogues.text: (furious) What did you want me to do? Take him in the back room and unzip his fly every time he fluffed a line? What else can I do for your film?

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: Just get your greedy little ass inside and make sure you give the performance of your life. (icily) This next number, I dedicate to you...dear.  172 173

Raymond, beyond tea destroyed, sits among the other refuse of the night: dere stoned kids, etc. On one bench is a SAILOR, with that ade look that betrays the weakness he tries to hide with his arrogance. dialogues.text: You can stop clowning, Eli, I've got a sworn complaint from this sailor... (jabbing his finer in Raymond's 0.S. direction) ...Your man over there touched his genitals.

dialogues.text: Oh, Jake! Come on! You wouldn't know your anal invert from a hole in the ground. Raymond makes bad jokes, but they're not illegal. Christ, you've seen us all on the set...clowning around.

dialogues.text: My company's been pouring sixty thousand dollars a week into this place, for which your mayor and governor seem very grateful! We paid enough in taxes and fees alone to buy you parking meters from here to the boardwalk!

dialogues.speaker: SAILOR
dialogues.text: (feeling it's all going wrong) Everything I said in that statement is the flat-ass truth! Eli pays no attention, knowing that he's got Jake. He ges toward Nina embracing Raymond.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: Jake, I got a very horny leading lady who's got an early call and would like to spend some time with her boyfriend before she makes "night-night." Now, can I please get 'em outta here before they really do something illegal...and in front of witnesses!

dialogues.text: It's three o'clock in the morning. The corridors are empt elevator door swings open and Nina and Eli step out and m the hallway, functioning on their last ounce of nervous e

dialogues.text: Sorry I had to put you through that. I know it was humiliating.

dialogues.speaker: NINA
dialogues.text: ...It was awful...I hated it. But you did save that man's life.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: Yeah, that was really nice of me. I'm a nice person. I just wish I had the strength to go to his room and break his spine. On the last day of filming the queen decides to come out of the closet! Wouldn't that have made a lovely headline? You understand, of course, that the film would've been destroyed. Doing that to me...

dialogues.text: Eli, what's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: Nothing serious. Just a little self-indulgence. Feel-sorry-for- Eli-time. Eli, on the edge of nervous exhaustion, is actually close

I did the same as everybody, just one of the boys... emptied my M-16 at any sound... don't know whether I killed gooks or cherries...the new kids from the States, we call ‘em cherries, which they were for maybe fifteen minutes. The dry season is when it really breaks loose. You get very tired. It's like falling asleep at the wheel. You close your eyes and it still goes on. You're killin' them, they're killin' you. Couldn't tell ya now what was real except I'm here. We sense in him the fatigue he is describing, then, pushi that memory.

dialogues.text: Hey, once when things were rough and the grass ran out, I shot the hell out of a water buffalo. (he considers, then passes judgment on himself) Actually, I wasn't a bad soldier...better than most. Got lotsa pretty ribbons. Funny...sort of like when I did that first stunt and everybody started clapping... nothing like a slap on the back to ruin a man, blow his sense of proportion. So, I got home...and, uh...I guess I expected something. Nothing fancy, but... something, you know...a free car wash, double blue chip stamps, extra time on the parking meter... I don't know... Instead, people... uh, didn't seem too pleased. (trying to hide a lot of pain) In fact, they acted like I was gonna start killing babies... She crosses to him, deeply moved.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Shit. I was supposed to get Married, run an ice cream parlor. (picks up his suitcases) I gotta go. 179B = Although they're standing only a couple of feet ap hand tentatively, as if to wave goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: I suppose there are cops in the woodwork! But what the hell...it's a nice night. (he starts to go) Lovers facing farewells have a gift for suspending time, speaks out, unable to let him leave.

dialogues.speaker: NINA
dialogues.text: I've always liked the woods at night. They're very romantic... You can hunt for truffles. It might be such fun, we'd just keep going. Cameron can't afford to fall for her softness.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: NINA
dialogues.text: That's true...One of them is three pages of me making a tunafish salad for an American flyer in 1917... And I've got to weigh that against losing the man I love. It's a big decision.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: Nina, you're making me crazy.

dialogues.speaker: NINA
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I'ma little crazy myself. I can't let you go and I don't even know who you are. (suddenly the dam bursts and all self-control is gone) Why are they chasing you?! What have you done? What happens to me in the woods? Will I need a bayonet too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 179¢ He stands there, staring at her, his face suddenly s everything, the lady is afraid of him. He picks up the du and moves for the door, then turns on her, punishing her words.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: The charge was attempted murder. I bashed this cop's head in. It took the jury about two fucking minutes. It could of been worse. It could of been life. But the judge...he looked real nice at me, and said you were a damn good soldier, son...So he only gave me twenty years. No way! Enough!...You know how long I was in that prison -- nineteen months -- and then I was gone! I was gone! She stares in shock and horror. His anger is like ice.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Caught me breaking into a store...oh, not to rob it...I went there to kill the bastard who owned it...

There in the basement of a 100-year old hotel, bef audience of one, Cameron ERUPTS, spewing out the memory o mortification and crucifixion...not without the silent re of Jesus, but with the howling rage of a mad dog...Pluto rabies...

Slack my ass...he just didn't want me hangin' around because he was bangin' my old lady. So I go down and start bangin' on his door! (he starts pounding on the mirror)

Come out here and be a man! Where are ya? Behind that counter, you son-of-a- bitch?" Cameron kicks over the makeup table as though it were the counter...tubes and glasses shatter all over the floor.

Although Cameron's got nothing in his hands, he pantomime that fifty-pound ice cream bucket around in the air, losi balance and landing on his back in the paint beside Nina. hysteria is renewed, but Cameron stops laughing.

I'll wake Mr. Cross up and ask him if you want, but it's an awful hour Should be somebody in the hotel kitchen by now. I'll get ‘em to rustle somethin' up for you. Maybe not pancakes, but eggs, if you want it.

dialogues.text: I can't believe it...He knows. The son-of-a-bitch knows whatever I'm thinking. I'm beginning to feel like something that Sam wrote! I'm not real. I'm some jerk American flyer from World War I who has to go over a bridge and die because the goddamn script says so! It's crazy...I'm trapped in his goddamn story. If somebody lost that page, I'd be fine. If he crossed it out and wrote something else like -- "At the last moment, he veers the big car from the railing--then goes speeding on to live happy ever after..." (he looks at the Duesenberg appraisingly, then grins as a plan starts to form) ...How about that?! Empty road, me out there all alone, the crew 'way back, breathless as I approach the bridge. And then..."Hey, what happened?!" A fucking rewrite's what happened! I'll have a fifteen- minute jump on them before they figure out they're shooting a new version!

dialogues.speaker: NINA

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: (interrupting) Oh, for Christ's sake...

It is a perfect day, tranquil exce faint distant "rumbling" intruding into our consciousness grows louder and LOUDER, a flock of birds is frightened f trees, a rusty beer can by the roadside begins to tremble from the vibration. Rounding the bend of the road into view are a half-dozen bicycles, peddling furiously, laughing and yelling and lo at what now appears behind them: the first vehicle of an carnival parade -- or is it a funeral procession? Long, s tall, fat vehicles; the stretch-out car, the cab towing p toilets, the tractor pulling a generator rig, the Cortez dressing rooms, the stake-bed loaded with reflectors ratt radar screens, panel trucks with studio emblems, a vintag army truck filled with soldiers, patrol cars and motorcyc huge, bright yellow construction crane on its Caterpillar its pneumatic snout jutting forward thirty yards like a m hard-on sniffing around for some tunnel to hump -- a few straddle it having their morning Danish and coffee. dialogues.text: I'm sending it on ahead. During the gag, it's gonna be comin' down the road towards you when you get to the bridge. Cameron tenses at this information.

dialogues.text: Relax, what does it change? I'm only tellin' you so you don't buzz off into space when you see ‘em. They'll be shooting at you and that's what's supposed to make you go into the river. 199A = They've reached the truck where Jake stands proudl Man is handing out rifles and boxes of bullets to the Ger soldiers, whom we now recognize as police officers from t One cop, tying his shoe, lifts his head and grins at Came old buddy -- the officer from the garage last night. CoP Hey, you ever get those pancakes?

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: ...My boys...Can't recognize ‘em. How could I say no, after all the crap they've taken because of this company the last six weeks?

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: (good-naturedly) Yeah, a cop'll do anything for fifty bucks, even be an actor.

dialogues.speaker: SECOND COP
dialogues.text: These guns are kinda modern for World War I.

dialogues.speaker: PROPERTY MASTER
dialogues.text: (to Chuck) You want me to drive back and get the old ones.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: (deciding) Shit...forget it. How much'll they see from the helicopter? If Cameron was upset by the change in the stunt, he is no unnerved by the sight of those cops with guns. The second loading cartridges.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: (starting back to Duesenberg) Hope those are really blanks.

dialogues.speaker: SECOND COP
dialogues.text: (chuckling) Don't say so on the box!

dialogues.speaker: DUESENBERG'S TRUNK
dialogues.text: As Cameron arrives and casually leans against the trunk a gently taps. He must get Nina out of there. With determin reaches for the trunk handle. Arms wearing the same costu own reach in, holding the trunk closed. It is Raymond.

dialogues.speaker: RAYMOND
dialogues.text: No need to look... If she loves you, she's still there. If she doesn't...then it doesn't really matter...does it? How can he know? -- Everything is out of control -- a voi

dialogues.text: Hey, Lucky, we need you! He turns and moves numbly to the car door. TECHNICIAN (CONT’D) Get in, will ya? Dazed, Cameron climbs behind the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TECHNICIAN (CONT’D) (leaning in passenger's side) Look straight ahead, can you see that red light out of the corner of your eye? A tiny red light is mounted in the corner over the windsh

dialogues.text: That'll let you know when the film's running, so be sure you don't turn your face to the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The technician tightens a final screw on the red light th back out of the car, yells 0.S.

dialogues.speaker: TECHNICIAN, (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: (by reflex) what? The words "CAMERA ON" sound exactly like "CAMERON." It so though his real name was called and he automatically answ his identity been exposed? His eyes widen. The technician no response, calls to Jake.

dialogues.speaker: TECHNICIAN
dialogues.text: Ask him if it's on?

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Cameron? He whirls to see Jake staring at him. His hand darts to t ignition key, the engine roars to life.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (startled) Hey, they wanna know is the CAMERA

dialogues.speaker: ON
dialogues.text: Cameron realizes his error, but it's too late, he's in a his mind, he's given himself away. The road ahead is clea He jams the car in gear and slams the accelerator to the Duesenberg leaps forward, screeching wildly. In its wake Everyone running, yelling...

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: (yelling) That crazy bastard! Who cued him? A.D.  193 194 195

dialogues.text: (shouts) Speed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speed. The needle hits sixty-five -- seventy -- climbing Cameron grips the wheel, looking at that empty road. An i shout swells up and escapes his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: (exultantly) Yahooo! (toward Nina in the trunk) Hang on to everything, baby, we're on our way! You okay? The needle hits eighty -- eighty-five. Ahead, the bridge toward us. Now the arches of the stone railing are strobi Through them, he sees the black river which he has escape Triumphantly, his hand rises, middle finger extended. Sud red camera light goes on, the underwater camera behind hi whirring. He moves his finger behind him for a perfect cl (recalling that moment in the tower):

dialogues.text: Crouching -- tensely watching the chalk line on the road Duesenberg flashes past. His finger presses a button.

dialogues.text: Blam! The whole front wheel of the car is blown off by an charge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Duesenberg drops on one axle. Metal screams against s though it were Cameron himself, screaming. Skidding, spin tearing through the papier-mache railing, plunging out of into space, where it hovers for a brief instant and arcs like a dying bird.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: A cry of such anguish and despair.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: (screaming) Ninaaa-a-a-a-a-!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The river rushes up and the car smashes into it with a de shattering roar, plunging beneath the surface to a dark a soundless world -- except for a tiny red light, the whir and Cameron's desperate cries. Tearing his seatbelt off h himself toward the rear of the car, clawing at the back s reach Nina. Incredibly, there is sunlight again as the ca buoyed to the surface. There, again, is the living world road, the trees. In that brief instant, through the rear Cameron has a wild, tilted glimpse of a pink pinafore -- standing by the rail looking down, Eli beside her. The ca downward, water rising swiftly over the rear window. The on Cameron's retina is that wild, eager, little-girl exci Nina's face. Then he's alone again, entombed in the darke as the car plunges toward the bottom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron sits, immobilized at the realization that his bet total. Everyone, even Nina, has conspired to bring him to red light glowing, camera whirring, to capture the moment death.  199 200 201

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outrage galvanizes him to action. He reaches for the door to rip them open -- they snap off in his hands. Now there rumbling and rending of metal as the roof begins to implo crushing down toward him. Under the immense pressure, the window bursts inward, the river rushing in a wild torrent memory of Chuck's voice..."the windows." He lowers the fr slowly. The water now pours in faster. The level has rise chin. He gasps a final breath and the water rises over hi Still the red light burns. He reaches beneath the seat fo oxygen cylinder and tries to pull it loose. It won't move impact of the car hitting the water has bent the seat fra groping hand finds the hose, the oxygen mask. A hope. Tho second is robbing his chance for life, his movements unde as in slow motion. Pulling the mask to his face, he takes breath and chokes as water fills his mouth. The rubber tu broken loose from the cylinder and is floating free -- as have with Burt. Pressure of the onrushing water has stopp water reaches the roof. For a moment there is a strange s which Cameron, his lungs bursting, swims through, out the toward the surface.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: Moving upward through river slime, in a world that grows a desperate race to reach air. Daylight! Gasping, half unconscious, barely able to move to stay afloat. Adrift in the current, he touches land, c the rocks and pulling himself onto the shore. His muscles moving by motor reflex, driven by survival instinct, take crawling from the river bank through the tall grass -- st fugitive, the "man on the run." Then, he lifts his head a at what he sees before him: Pov Fanned out across the field is a row of men, guns held re Policemen from the truck in their German uniforms moving slowly -- carefully searching the terrain in an arch whic closes, must irrevocably reach Cameron.

dialogues.text: It's over. Without strength or will, he lies waiting for though his eyes were made of glass. They see him now, but pace doesn't change. As they take the last few steps towa sees their shoulders, waists, knees and then only a circl around him. Their hands roughly grab him, pulling him to his feet, sh brutallv about. Some of them are walking Where are the handcuffs? Why is he shaking my hand instea the jumble of voices is becoming clearer..."No matter wha you, make 'em give you a raise!"..."Fantastic, my wife th a cop is dangerous -- you guys are terrific!" It finally the insane, absurd, devastating, humiliating realization all just another scene in a movie that came off as planne

dialogues.text: He is alive and free. Is that gurgle we hear in Cameron's the water that he swallowed or an unseemly giggle? Then i into laughter. Pov Here comes Chuck, running across the field with his silly filled with elastic bandages. How funny. Here's the helic hovering with Gabe descending the rope ladder bearing fil who runs to meet him. How hilarious. There's the pink pinafore...Nina holding the skirt up to her waist as she through the tall grass towards him. How sweetly absurd. A.D. All right, come on...let's get the stuff in the trucks, we're losing sun!

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: Chuck has reached Cameron, throwing a blanket over him. H pint from his back pocket.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: Take a belt. Don't be stingy. As Cameron tilts his head back, the bottle to his mouth, skin divers setting down their rescue equipment and strip their dripping wet-suits.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: Those guys down there the whole time? Chuck, who is rubbing Cameron violently through the blank restore his circulation, replies with the highest complim pay?

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: I can't hear ya...they're clangin' too loud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina has reached an impasse twenty yards away in her jour toward Cameron -- a muddy section of swamp.

dialogues.speaker: NINA
dialogues.text: (shouts across the distance to Cameron) I can't come any further. What should I do? I'll get the dress all muddy and I need it for the next scene.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: (grinning with good nature) Tunafish salad...I know.

dialogues.speaker: NINA
dialogues.text: (shouts) They found me five minutes after you left. I felt ridiculous.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: (waves back) Just as well!

dialogues.speaker: NINA
dialogues.text: (shouts) When Eli told me you'd changed your mind and decided to do the stunt, at first I didn't believe him, but I guess you really did. I tried to find you. Eli is standing nearby listening to this macabre exchange lovers.

dialogues.speaker: NINA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to include E1i) I'm sure glad you two made up! Boy, Lucky, were you wonderful...I guess I have to go now. See you after. She awkwardly turns, her dress still held high and yells her shoulder...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry I was so nutty last night. I always get crazy at the end of a film. Nina continues picking her way toward the road. And then.

dialogues.speaker: NINA
dialogues.text: Suddenly she turns, running headlong, pell-mell across th through the mud holes, drenching her pink pinafore into a losing a shoe, ripping her hose -- and then wildly into t Cameron, smearing him with love and mud! And then, just a she is gone, racing back across the field, hopping like a without her shoe, toward the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron is brimming with pleasure. Chuck, totally ignored his stunt bag.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: (dryly) Lover, I think your circulation's back to normal. And please, next time will ya listen for the cue -- the word is "action."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks off, leaving Cameron draped in the blanket like Eli steps up to him looking very serious, lifts his hand Indian sign of greeting and says:

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: "How!" I have always had a great compassion for your people. Long before it was popular, I felt a repugnance for General Custer. Cameron stares at him, incredulous.

dialogues.speaker: ELI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: My God, I think he's breathing. There're days I can't do anything right. I hope this doesn't screw up our relationship, your being alive and all.  Sam has run up,

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: (shaking his head) ...You sure took a hell of a chance, Eli...why didn't you just let me go last night?

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: What, with Nina in the trunk? I've got scenes to shoot with her...

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: ..-All right. This morning then. Chuck could have done the stunt.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: (thoughtfully) I knew a guy who made an anti-war film. When they previewed it in his hometown, army enlistment went up six hundred percent. I'm making this film trying to convince the whole world that maybe there's a better way to get home for Thanksgiving...and I can't even convince one dumb kid with a tattoo...I couldn't have you run around paranoid the rest of your life thinking I was trying to kill you.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: Paranoid? out of breath, followed by crew members.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: Hey Sam, the kid just licked your screenplay. He named the disease.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Yeah, what?

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: ...a social disease, very common.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: ...like gonorrhea...

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: You're close. It's spread the same way...by screwing your fellow man.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: I hope you find an easier cure. That was the hardest thousand bucks I ever made. A horn honks. It is Jake who, in his enthusiasm, has driv police car bumping over the marshes to Eli and Cameron.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: You guys want a ride back?

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: (moving toward the helicopter ) No, we're goin' in the chopper.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: (considers it) Thanks, Eli, but that looks too dangerous. I think I'll ride with Jake. Good luck with the picture. He moves toward police car.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: (yelling to Cameron) Don't miss that plane, Burt!

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: (leaning across Cameron to yell at Eli) He better not! Any member of your company found within city limits after five o'clock tonight, gets shot on sight! Eli stops, suddenly registering what Cameron had said.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: ...What thousand bucks? That stunt paid six-fifty.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: (surprised) Chuck told me a thousand...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (firmly) Six-fifty!

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: (getting upset) A thousand!

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: (relenting) Okay, seven-fifty. Split the difference...

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: Bullshit! You're trying to screw me!!

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: (exasperated) Christ! You're doing it again! (striding toward the chopper, shouting) Sam! This paranoid little bastard still doesn't understand your damn screenplay!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli is climbing into the helicopter. The helicopter hammerhead and Eli's voice on canvon. as the

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: (shrieking) That's your big problem, Eli! You use people! I want my money, a thousand bucks!

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: (to Cameron) Six-fifty!! (to Sam) Rewrite the battle scene and let the tank run him over! The stunt pays six-fifty! takes off, zooms under the bridge, up into a soars back, while Cameron continues to scream at it.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: Come back here. I'm tired of being your goddamn clown! Pay me my thousand bucks! the helicopter's P.A. speaker echoes through the chopper cavorts overhead and skims awav.
